data.title: Create script/clean
data.body:
Make a grunt-free script that will clean up Atom no matter what. Something along the lines of...

``` shell
pkill -9 Atom &&
cd ~/github/atom &&
rm -rf node_modules atom-shell ~/.atom/.node-type ~/.atom/storage /tmp/atom-build /tmp/atom-cached-atom-shells /tmp/atom-compile-cache
```

... we will need a windows version of this as well.

data.title: Observe editor.tabLength config in TokenizedBuffer
data.body: Closes #1224

data.title: Add a splash of color to commit messages
A series of unfortunate events
data.body:
I'm not sure what to call this issue, please rename it.

I quit Atom to get around another instance of #1231. There was allegedly an update pending. After I quit:

```
$ atom
LSOpenURLsWithRole() failed for the application /Applications/Atom.app with error -10810.
```

I assume this happens when the `atom` helper is invoked during `finish_installation`'s run. `finish_installation` is also a bad name for an app that shows up in a user's dock, even briefly.

Running `atom` again starts the shell, but crashes immediately, I would copy/paste the exception here, but I can't copy text from the web inspector.

I figured I'd run `atom -f` to get the backtrace in my terminal, but I forgot to shut down Atom first. The output distracted me for a minute because there's some CFAllocator cruft:

```
$ atom -f
2013-12-06 10:38:10.028 Atom[20056:507] Internals of CFAllocator not known; out-of-memory failures via CFAllocator will not result in termination. http://crbug.com/45650
2013-12-06 10:38:10.194 Atom[20056:507] "App load time: 131ms"
$ echo $?
0
```

Maybe behavior should be different if you invoke `atom -f` when Atom is already running.

Finally I stopped being an idiot, quit Atom.app, ran `atom -f`, and captured the output:

```
$ atom -f
2013-12-06 10:43:26.021 Atom[20082:507] Internals of CFAllocator not known; out-of-memory failures via CFAllocator will not result in termination. http://crbug.com/45650
2013-12-06 10:43:26.177 Atom[20082:507] "App load time: 121ms"
2013-12-06 10:43:31.093 Atom Helper[20083:507] Internals of CFAllocator not known; out-of-memory failures via CFAllocator will not result in termination. http://crbug.com/45650
[1206/104331:INFO:renderer_main.cc(212)] Renderer process started
[1206/104331:INFO:CONSOLE(991)] "[Q] Unhandled rejection reasons (should be empty):", source: /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/q/q.js (991)
Dec  6 10:43:31 jmac.local Atom Helper[20083] <Error>: The function `CGFontSetShouldUseMulticache' is obsolete and will be removed in an upcoming update. Unfortunately, this application, or a library it uses, is using this obsolete function, and is thereby contributing to an overall degradation of system performance.
2013-12-06 10:43:31.466 Atom Helper[20084:507] Internals of CFAllocator not known; out-of-memory failures via CFAllocator will not result in termination. http://crbug.com/45650
[1206/104331:INFO:renderer_main.cc(212)] Renderer process started
[1206/104331:INFO:CONSOLE(20)] "Error: /Users/jbarnette/src/jbarnette/tu/src/tu/cli is a directory
    at new File (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/file.js:29:15)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.setPath (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-buffer.js:229:21)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.attached (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-buffer.js:71:12)
    at Map.module.exports.Document.callModelAttachedHooks (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/document.js:104:90)
    at Map.module.exports.Document.createModel (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/document.js:94:19)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/database.js:172:25
    at Map.module.exports.Document.traverseBottomUp (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/document.js:133:14)
    at Map.module.exports.Document.traverseBottomUp (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/document.js:130:16)
    at Map.module.exports.Document.traverseBottomUp (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/document.js:130:16)
    at Map.module.exports.Document.traverseBottomUp (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/document.js:130:16)
    at Database.module.exports.Database.registerModelClasses (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/database.js:171:29)
    at Map.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/node_modules/delegato/lib/delegator.js:46:68)
    at Atom.module.exports.Atom.loadWindowState (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom.js:443:11)
    at Atom.module.exports.Atom.getWindowState (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom.js:464:33)
    at Atom.module.exports.Atom.initialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom.js:87:73)
    at Atom.module.exports.Atom.setUpEnvironment (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom.js:92:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:17:8)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:23:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:471:26)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:489:10)
    at Module.load (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/coffee-script.js:211:36)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:327:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:379:17)
    at require (module.js:395:17)
    at window.onload (file:///Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/static/index.html:12:9)", source: file:///Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/static/index.html (20)
Dec  6 10:43:31 jmac.local Atom Helper[20084] <Error>: The function `CGFontSetShouldUseMulticache' is obsolete and will be removed in an upcoming update. Unfortunately, this application, or a library it uses, is using this obsolete function, and is thereby contributing to an overall degradation of system performance.
```

After sifting through a bunch of crap:

```
[1206/104331:INFO:CONSOLE(20)] "Error: /Users/jbarnette/src/jbarnette/tu/src/tu/cli is a directory
```

I have no idea why Atom would be trying to treat this as a file. I haven't done anything fancy with it. I killed all my storage with `rm -rf ~/.atom/storage` and restarted.

data.title: Makefile editing is messed up. If it's not using so
data.body:
Makefile editing is messed up. If it's not using soft tabs instead of hard ones, it's positioning the cursor in weird places. To repro, just write yourself a simple Makefile with a single rule and try to run it. Then edit it in an external editor to fix indentation, then add another rule or two in Atom.

data.title: I was hacking on an experimental project with 20-30
data.body:
I was hacking on an experimental project with 20-30 files open. I wanted to take a completely different stab, so I created a new orphan branch in Git and started over from scratch. I knew Atom wouldn't be able to handle the abrupt transition, so I quit (eventually, after telling Atom not to save a bunch of stuff). When I reopened Atom, it still has the tree-view and buffers from all the files I had open in the other branch., _plus_ the files and directories in the new branch. The tree-view doesn't reflect reality at all. In the attached screenshot the only thing that actually exists on disk right now is an empty `src/github.com/jbarnette/tu` directory.

data.title: Add token dealings to atom core
data.body:
So more and more packages are using the auth token. I want a unified way to deal with this thing. So far, what I have (`atom.getGitHubTokenName()`) is the minimum IMO I want in there. But we could include keytar and have access to the token in the core. Like:

``` coffeescript
setGitHubAuthToken: (token) ->
  keytar.replacePassword('Atom GitHub API Token', 'github', token)

getGitHubAuthToken: ->
  keytar.getPassword('Atom GitHub API Token', 'github')

deleteGitHubAuthToken: ->
  keytar.deletePassword('Atom GitHub API Token', 'github')
```

WDYT? Good? Bad? Ugly?

data.title: Atom has a hard time with really long strings (data URIs)
data.body:
I'm using data URIs (super long strings) as background image urls in css in an html file. When I click anywhere on the uri line, Atom locks up for a few seconds. This happens any time the URI is clicked, not just on the first click. Clicking anywhere else in the file works fine.

Navigating into the URI with the keyboard does not experience the lag, so it's just on click.

Since it's anywhere in the line rather than just on the URI, my guess is that it's not a syntax highlighting thing.

data.title: Atom can't open specific folder.
data.body:
When I try to add the atom.io repo folder to atom, I get a white screen and this in the console:

```
TypeError: Cannot call method 'addMarkerAtLevel' of undefined
    at IntervalSkipList.module.exports.IntervalSkipList.placeMarker (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/node_modules/interval-skip-list/lib/interval-skip-list.js:309:14)
    at IntervalSkipList.module.exports.IntervalSkipList.insert (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/node_modules/interval-skip-list/lib/interval-skip-list.js:116:12)
    at IntervalSkipList.module.exports.IntervalSkipList.update (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/node_modules/interval-skip-list/lib/interval-skip-list.js:140:19)
    at ArrayMarker.module.exports.ArrayMarker.updateIndices (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/array-marker.js:665:51)
    at new ArrayMarker (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/array-marker.js:42:12)
    at Array.module.exports.Array.finalizeCreation (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/array.js:81:30)
    at Map.module.exports.Map.finalizeCreation (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/map.js:54:15)
    at Array.module.exports.Array.finalizeCreation (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/array.js:99:15)
    at Map.module.exports.Map.finalizeCreation (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/map.js:54:15)
    at Map.module.exports.Map.finalizeCreation (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/map.js:54:15)
    at Function.module.exports.Database.deserialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/database.js:54:26)
    at Function.module.exports.Document.deserialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/telepath/lib/document.js:48:32)
    at Atom.module.exports.Atom.loadWindowState (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom.js:442:24)
    at Atom.module.exports.Atom.getWindowState (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom.js:468:33)
    at Atom.module.exports.Atom.initialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom.js:87:73)
    at Atom.module.exports.Atom.setUpEnvironment (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom.js:92:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:17:8)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:23:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:471:26)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:489:10)
    at Module.load (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/coffee-script.js:211:36)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:327:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:379:17)
    at require (module.js:395:17)
    at window.onload (file:///Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/static/index.html:12:9) index.html:20
window.onload
```

I've tried and reproduced this error dragging the folder onto the icon, the window, and by going via `file > open`. My guess is that there's something corrupted in whatever stores the project state, because other folders open fine.

data.title: weird cursor issues
data.body:
Getting some whack cursor behavior on atom 0.41.0:

I'm trying to write the `_` outside of the quotes.  But it stays inside.

I tried to fix it manually, but it won't let me.

This is what I want:

```
_ "./cache"
```

data.title: Creating a new file takes a long time
data.body: I'm seeing anywhere from 2-5 seconds to create a new file when I hit command-N.

data.title: Menu bar flashes when I create a new document
data.body:
This one's odd.

When I hit command-N to create a new document, the app's menu bar flashes a few times before creating the new document.

data.title: Command-W doesn't close the window
data.body: It appears to only close the current tab. If you close all the tabs, command-W doesn't close the window.
